subject: In tonight's programme
body:
BBC EMAIL NEWS - HTML

 Other

						TUESDAY 8 MAY 22:30 BST - BBC TWO


						FROM PROGRAMME PRODUCER ROBERT MORGAN
					
					Hello,



NORTHERN IRELAND


On what can be described as a truly historic day, power has been returned to the devolved Northern Ireland Assembly at Stormont, ending five years of direct rule from Westminster. The Democratic Unionist, Ian Paisley, has become first minister; his deputy is Martin McGuinness from Sinn Fein. Liz Mackean will be presenting from Stormont and Jeremy Paxman will be in London.	


Liz has been following the day's momentous events and will be asking the Democratic Unionists and Sinn Fein if they really can work together. 


And who exactly were the winners and the losers from the forty years of the Troubles? We'll be debating that with Northern Ireland Secretary, Peter Hain and other senior figures.


POLITICS


Our Political Editor, Michael Crick will have the latest on the Scottish elections voting fiasco, Zombie Brown's cabinet re-shuffle rumours and the Home office shake-up tomorrow.


MADELEINE


Residents in the Algarve have continued to help the police search for the missing British three year old, Madeleine McCann. We'll have the latest.


SARKOZY


Now that Sarkozy is president-elect of France what are the challenges ahead for him? Allan Little reports from Paris on the man described as the next Gallic Thatcher.


Newsnight is on BBC2 at 10.30pm.


Robert
